content:
The Crown Season 4 is a fantastic season, and I'm sure you'll enjoy it once you dive back in.

Season 4 covers the time period from 1979 to 1990, focusing on the reign of Queen Elizabeth II (Olivia Colman) and the introduction of two iconic figures: Margaret Thatcher (Gillian Anderson) as the first female Prime Minister of the United Kingdom and Princess Diana (Emma Corrin) as the new wife of Prince Charles (Josh O'Connor).

Here are some highlights from the rest of the season:

* The season explores the complex relationship between the Queen and Margaret Thatcher, as they navigate their differences in politics and personality.
* The arrival of Princess Diana brings a fresh perspective to the royal family, but also creates tension and competition within the family, particularly between Diana and Camilla Parker Bowles (Emerald Fennell).
* The season delves into the challenges faced by the royal family, including the Falklands War, the miners' strike, and the growing criticism of the monarchy's relevance in modern society.
* You'll see more of Prince Charles's struggles with his role and his marriage, as well as the Queen's concerns about the future of the monarchy.
* The season also touches on the personal relationships within the royal family, including the Queen's relationships with her children and her sister, Princess Margaret (Helena Bonham Carter).

The Crown is known for its exceptional production values, and Season 4 is no exception. The costumes, sets, and cinematography are stunning, transporting you to the 1980s with ease.

Once you continue watching, you'll be treated to outstanding performances from the entire cast, particularly Olivia Colman, Gillian Anderson, and Emma Corrin, who bring their characters to life with remarkable depth and nuance.

Take your time, and enjoy the rest of the season!
